At Jack Henry, we’re more than a technology company, we’re a force for good in financial services. We’re redefining how community banks and credit unions connect with the people they serve. Our mission is rooted in people inspired innovation, empowering financial institutions to deliver seamless, secure, and human centered experiences. We deliver cutting-edge solutions that are paving the way for the next generation of digital banking and payments, but our true impact begins with our associates.  If you're ready to help transform an industry and grow with a company that values purpose, collaboration, and excellence then we’d love to meet you.
The Senior Enterprise Solutions Architect: Salesforce is the strategic design authority across the platform and as the enterprise representative. This role ensures that multi-cloud, multi-org, and multi-integration implementations are architected for scale, compliance, and longevity. The Architect leads end-to-end program architecture, enterprise alignment, risk governance, technical leadership, and cross-team orchestration for transformational Salesforce initiatives.
This position may be worked remotely within the United States, with the exception of California.
This position is ineligible for immigration sponsorship and support. Please do not apply if at any time you will need immigration support now or in the future (i.e., H-1B, STEM OPT Training Plans, etc.).
All positions, regardless of location, may require an onsite interview or in-person onboarding requirement to verify your identity.
What you’ll be responsible for:
Program-Level Architecture Leadership
Define and own the architectural blueprint for Salesforce programs spanning multiple initiatives
Set solution guardrails, standards, and patterns across project tracks
Lead end-to-end solution architecture decisions, ensuring consistency across systems
Provide oversight for technical designs—Flows, Apex, APIs, Integrations, Experience Cloud, Data Models
Author and maintain Architecture Decision Records (ADRs), RACI, and governance playbooks
Cross-Org & Multi-Cloud Strategy
Architect across Sales, Service, Experience, CPQ, MuleSoft, and integrated ERP/QMS systems
Align Salesforce with Enterprise Architecture, Security, and Data Governance frameworks
Lead solutioning for identity, authorization, sharing, and zero-trust patterns
Integration & Data Architecture
Define high-complexity integration patterns (event-driven, async, middleware, orchestration, streaming)
Responsible for data strategy: canonical models, deduplication, MDM alignment, regulatory compliance (HIPAA, PCI, SOX, GDPR)
Oversee migration of large datasets
Program Governance & Delivery
Provide architectural approvals during PI planning, estimations, and release cycles
Partner with (C)PMO, Program Managers, and Release/DevOps teams to ensure alignment to timelines & scope
Establish non-functional requirements (NFRs) for performance, availability, scalability, and extensibility
Identify architectural risks early and drive mitigation plans
Technical Leadership & Mentorship
Lead technical architects, solution architects, senior admins, and developers
Provide coaching on architectural best practices, integration frameworks, and secure coding / Flow design
Drive continuous improvement across DevOps, CI/CD, testing standards, and deployment pipelines
Executive & Stakeholder Communication
Present architecture direction, risks, and decisions to senior leadership
Translate architectural decisions into business outcomes and program impacts
Drive consensus across business units and technology teams
Performs other duties as assigned.
What you’ll need to have:
10+ years Salesforce ecosystem experience with deep multi-cloud expertise
Demonstrated experience architecting large-scale (10,000+ users), mission-critical programs
Strong command of security models, zero trust patterns, OAuth/OIDC, API gateways

At Jack Henry, we deliver technology solutions that are digitally transforming and empowering community banks and credit unions to provide enhanced and streamlined user experiences to their customers and members. Our best-in-class products are just the start as we lay the groundwork for the future of digital banking and payments. We hope you'll join us. We can't do it without you.
We have an immediate need for a talented, data-driven Senior Financial Analyst to become an integral part of our Decision Support team. This role works closely with Jack Henry’s finance leadership to dive deep into revenue and cost analysis, build efficient processes to consolidate financial information, and develop insights that summarize current results with an eye toward future impact.  The ideal candidate will have exceptional communication skills, be a team player, and be ready to join a fast-paced, growth mindset environment.
Your Impact:
Utilize your analytical prowess to dissect and understand the intricacies of revenue and expenses, delivering insights that drive business decisions.
Take charge of financial consolidation with a keen eye for detail and a commitment to accuracy.
Drives business performance by providing actionable financial insights and supporting operational decisions.
Be the go-to expert for process enhancements, streamlining our financial operations with your innovative solutions.
Bring your creative spirit while developing unforgettable executive presentations that tell the story of our business.
Lead special projects, showcasing your ability to manage complex tasks.
This position is hybrid and may be located in any of the following locations: Allen, TX / Lenexa, KS / Monett, MO or Springfield, MO.  You will be required to come onsite at least 1 time per week for corporate events, team meetings or collaboration sessions. The remainder of the time, you are able to work remotely from home.
This position will have a salary range of $72,700 – $105,000 based on experience and location.
What you'll be responsible for:
Collect, analyze, and interpret revenue & expense data to identify trends, opportunities, and risks. Develop actionable insights that support strategic decision-making and optimization.
Build and maintain sophisticated models and templates that forecast financial performance within segments, lines of business, and products.
Prepares and presents reporting packages to senior management team and provide recommendations to management based on analysis. Will transform complex financial data into user-friendly, easy-to-understand charts, graphs, and other visualizations.
Collaborate closely with FP&A teams to gain a deep understanding of existing processes, gather feedback, and deliver data-driven insights that support monthly, quarterly, and year-end reporting.
Maintain and enhance internal reporting tools and systems. Identify opportunities to automate and streamline revenue reporting processes, and support implementation of new analytics technologies.
May perform other job duties as assigned.
What you'll need to have:
Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics or Business Administration.
Must have a minimum of 6 years of experience within any of the following finance categories: Corporate Finance, FP&A, or Finance Operations.  Experience within a consolidated reporting environment is a plus.
Advanced level experience with MS Excel (build financial models).
Advanced level experience with PowerPoint to develop and execute executive level presentations.
Ability to effectively plan, prioritize, and organize a diversified workload to meet aggressive deadlines.
Strong business acumen and desire to strengthen knowledge of the business/industry.
Must be able to work outside business hours and occasional weekends as needed to support business needs.
Ability to travel up to 10% to attend team meetings, trainings, and/or professional conferences.
What would be nice for you to have:
Experience working in a Senior Financial Analyst role specifically focused on revenue and expense analytics.
Ability to collaborate with non-financial stakeholders (e.g., Sales, Operations, HR) to align financial objectives with business unit priorities.
Experience working with OneStream, Tableau, Power BI, and Peoplesoft.
Proficient in creating special reporting, interactive dashboards, financial modeling, or executive presentations.
Experience in a Financial or Technology Services organization.
Ability to make recommendations to improve efficiency of processes and procedures.
Able to work with confidential materials and maintain confidentiality at all times.

At Jack Henry, we deliver technology solutions that are digitally transforming and empowering community banks and credit unions to provide enhanced and streamlined user experiences to their customers and members. Our best-in-class products are just the start as we lay the groundwork for the future of digital banking and payments. We hope you'll join us. We can't do it without you.
The Identity & Access Management (IAM) Senior Engineer will independently lead the development and enhancement of IAM products like SailPoint, Saviynt, and Okta, and influences stakeholders on future improvements. Implements role management, lifecycle management, and access certifications, while solving business problems and coaching peers. Stays updated on industry trends, solves technical issues, supports IAM applications, and trains users. Manages identity lifecycle with Active Directory, troubleshoots with SIEM tools, implements IAM policies, integrates with cloud platforms, automates processes, and enhances security initiatives.
This position may be worked remotely within the United States, with the exception of California.
East coast applicants must be willing to work central or mountain time zone hours.
All positions, regardless of location, may require an onsite interview or in-person onboarding requirements to verify your identity.
This position is not eligible for immigration sponsorship and support. Please do not apply if at any time you will need immigration support now or in the future (i.e., H-1B, STEM OPT Training Plans, etc.).
What you’ll be responsible for:
Plans, designs, develops, redesigns, and implements various technology IAM products, such as Sailpoint, Saviynt, Okta and recommendations to influence key stakeholders on additional/future enhancements.
Performs the analyzing and implementation of authorization methods such as, RBAC/ABAC/PBAC role management, Lifecycle Management, Separation of Duties (SOD), Access Certifications, etc.
Develops the configuring, integrating, and tailoring of existing IAM products to solve identified business problems or to suit a client's requirements.
Reviews IAM technical white papers and provides guidance to team on future offerings to help people better understand the technology behind them.
Manages Identity Lifecycle Management with Microsoft Active Directory which includes developing and managing the Access Certifications lifecycle accounts (assign permissions, delete accounts, and complete appropriate modifications for role changes).
Performs integrations with directories (both in the cloud and on-prem) and cloud platforms (ex. AWS, GCP, and Azure).
Integrates the business needs with technology and standards related to identity creation, deletions, vaulting and password management.
Creates and updates metrics, including automating data collection and aggregation.
Builds automation through integrations using Powershell scripts, RPA, SQL, and other automation tools and Power Automate.
Participates in information gathering meetings with clients to determine the client’s needs, business goals, and desired outcomes.
Performs other duties as assigned.
What you’ll need to have:
Minimum of 6 years’ experience with Identity and Access Management.
Minimum of 4 years’ experience with SailPoint engineering and/or architecting.
Experience with SailPoint IdentityNow (IDN) or SailPoint Identity Security Cloud (ISC). Advanced understanding of IAM platforms (SailPoint, Saviynt, Okta) to develop and scale with the organization.
Experience with creating and updating scripts and code.
Experience with API’s (REST, JSON) and cloud infrastructure.
What would be nice for you to have:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Cybersecurity preferred.
Expert knowledge of access management frameworks (RBAC/ABAC/PBAC).
Deep understanding of Microsoft Active Directory and cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure).
Comprehensive understanding of security and access certification processes.
Proficiency in automation tools (PowerShell, RPA, SQL, Power Automate).
Experience with cloud and on-premises directory integrations.
Expertise in access certification and SOD implementation.
Strong leadership capabilities in technical project implementation.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to translate complex technical concepts for various audiences.
Ability to generate and interpret metrics and reports.
Experience with Privileged Access Management tools (eg. Delinea Secret Server).

description_text:
General information

JobID

Senior Manager
Team
Information Technology
Working Time
Full-Time

Regular

Description & Requirements
Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
At Jack Henry, we’re more than a technology company; we’re a force for good in financial services. We’re redefining how community banks and credit unions connect with the people they serve. Our mission is rooted in people-inspired innovation, empowering financial institutions to deliver seamless, secure, and human-centered experiences. We deliver cutting-edge solutions that are paving the way for the next generation of digital banking and payments, but our true impact begins with our associates. If you're ready to help transform an industry and grow with a company that values purpose, collaboration, and excellence, then we’d love to meet you.
We are seeking a Senior Manager to oversee the direction of our IT Asset Management and Configuration Management divisions. This individual will provide high-level strategic oversight, ensuring that we are making continued progress and adhere to existing roadmaps as our posture in these areas matures. The senior manager position oversees managers of Hardware Asset Management, Software Asset Management, and Configuration Management. As a leader of these teams, this individual would work closely with these managers as well as other leaders throughout our enterprise to provide strategic direction, ensure compliance, oversee vendor management, provide reporting, and continuously improve our operations.
This position can be based to work out of any Jack Henry office or remotely from any US location,
with the exception of California
. Salary range for this position is $119,000-175,000, depending on candidate experience and geographic location. All positions, regardless of location, may require an onsite interview or in-person onboarding requirement to verify your identity.
What you’ll be responsible for:
Proactively managing all technology assets throughout their lifecycle.
Establishing the appropriate governance model to ensure that assets are properly owned and managed throughout the enterprise.
Ensuring that configuration baselines for all technology types and configuration drift is effectively managed and governed closely through IT Change management.
Ensuring that the CMDB is accurate and up to date.
May have some financial responsibilities including project cost estimating, proposal generation, and invoicing.
Writes and presents business cases as needed for promoting ITSM.
Prepares presentations on ITSM practices for technical, operational, and management staff.
Stays abreast of current Service Management trends, capabilities, and methodologies.
Assists in transformational change through developing and promoting practical ITSM practices.
Oversees the enhancement of ITSM practices based on business goals, proactive research, collaboration and feedback around the effectiveness and efficiency of processes; teams; tools; and partners.
Understands the business value needed from ITSM practices and ensure the value is realized by focusing on practical and helpful processes and methodologies.
Aids in the integration of ITSM practices and ITSM tools and technologies for the execution of practice processes.
Engages with Practice Managers, Service Owners, Product Teams, and Business Leaders as appropriate.
Is accountable for KPIs and metrics related to the performance of ITSM practices.
Creates and manages staffing plans to ensure service levels are maintained.
May perform other job duties as assigned.
What you’ll need to have:
A minimum of 10 years of experience in IT operations and/or service management in large-scale IT organizations.
A minimum of 3 years as a manager or director within IT organizations.
A minimum of 3 years of experience working with ServiceNow.
Experience with IT asset management in both hardware and software, as well as understanding of asset lifecycle management.
Experience with the use of Configuration Management Databases (CMDB).
Understanding of the Common Service Data Model.
Ability to travel up to 15% for business meetings and conferences.
What would be nice for you to have:
ITIL Foundation or Expert certification.
Knowledge of change management methodology.
Knowledge of ServiceNow and other tools used in ITSM environment.

At Jack Henry, we’re more than a technology company, we’re a force for good in financial services. We’re redefining how community banks and credit unions connect with the people they serve. Our mission is rooted in people inspired innovation, empowering financial institutions to deliver seamless, secure, and human centered experiences. We deliver cutting-edge solutions that are paving the way for the next generation of digital banking and payments, but our true impact begins with our associates.  If you're ready to help transform an industry and grow with a company that values purpose, collaboration, and excellence then we’d love to meet you. We’re reinventing the way people interact with their finances, and we could use your help. Working at Jack Henry offers you a chance to think about and solve fascinating, important problems. Here, everyone has a voice, a chance to ask tough questions, and an opportunity to innovate.
As a Senior Go-To-Market (GTM) Product Manager for the Origination and Financial Crimes teams, you’ll be responsible for developing and executing go-to-market strategies for launching new products or features as part of our complementary services group.
You will focus on helping customers harness the power of Jack Henry products, which drive financial institutions’ success by improving personnel productivity and by making their banking solutions more accessible to the consumer.
This role involves working cross-functionally with product development, design, marketing, sales, and operation teams to ensure that our products meet market needs and achieve business objectives. In short, your work will directly benefit Jack Henry customers, end users, and internal teams, ultimately accelerating customer adoption and empowering community banks and credit unions to compete with fintech giants.
We are committed to creativity, thoughtfulness, culture, and openness—the perfect place to make phenomenal products that have a big impact. Our work environment echoes a modern tech start-up, but we have the security and benefits of a large, publicly traded company. We place high value on continued education and contribute to, and use, open-source projects.
This position may be worked remotely within the United States, with the exception of California.
All positions, regardless of location, may require an onsite interview or in-person onboarding requirement to verify your identity.
Must be able to travel up to 15% to attend onsite meetings or trainings.
What you’ll be responsible for:
Develop and implement comprehensive GTM strategies for new and existing products or features.
Conduct well-rounded research to understand business goals, systems models, and customer models to create messaging that speaks to customers’ goals and promotes revenue-generating product offerings.
Drive our ever-evolving product story forward through communication of our features and the benefits of new products to customers.
Build and maintain close relationships with all customer-facing and internal teams to ensure a seamless customer experience.
Ensure a smooth turnover to the implementation or support organizations that includes planning, training, and hand-off.
Provide product training and guidance to the Sales organization.
Develop trusted advisory partnerships and advocates with strategically selected customers and engage the right teams to ensure customer success.
Provide mentorship and coaching to team members, fostering their professional growth and development.
Embody and promote Jack Henry’s core values and culture, serving as a role model and ensuring alignment with organizational principles in all aspects of work.
May perform other job duties as assigned.
What you’ll need to have:
Minimum of 6 years of experience in product marketing, go-to-market solutions, product management, and/or product growth with the ability to think and work creatively.
Proficiency in using project management and collaboration tools (e.g., Notion. HelpScout, Jira, Figma, Wistia, Github, or CMS experience).
Proven track record of successfully launching and managing products in a fast-paced environment.
Effective written and verbal communication, consultation, and presentation skills.
Experience with cross-team collaboration and the ability to work toward strategic goals in a fast-paced team environment.
Discipline to consistently self-start, self-serve, and work independently in a remote environment.
Ability to travel up to 15% for business meetings and client site visits.
What would be nice for you to have:
Bachelor’s degree.
Detail-oriented and highly organized.
Ability to thrive in a dynamic and rapidly changing environment.
Using AI tools to improve workflow efficiencies.

We’re looking for passionate, driven individuals who align with our mission and can bring unique perspectives to our team.
Why Jack Henry?
At Jack Henry, we live by the motto: “
Do the right thing, do whatever it takes, and have fun.”
It’s more than a tagline, it’s the foundation of our culture. We recognize that our associates are the key to our success, and we’re deeply committed to their wellbeing. That’s why we offer
comprehensive benefits
designed to support your physical, mental, and financial health so you can thrive both personally and professionally.
We’re also leading the way in technology modernization, helping financial institutions evolve with speed, security, and flexibility. Our strategy focuses on delivering secure data access, mitigating fraud, and enabling seamless integration.  Empowering our teams to build innovative solutions that meet the evolving needs of accountholders.

Ask our associates why they love Jack Henry, and many will tell you it is because our culture is exceptional. We do great things together. Our culture empowers us to rise to challenges, seek new opportunities, and support one another through change. It’s this shared commitment that drives our success. site to learn more about our culture and commitment to our people, customers, community, environment, and shareholders.

The Senior Automation Engineer works independently to design, build, and maintain advanced automated testing frameworks that ensure quality throughout the entire software development lifecycle. They guide products from early concept through production by embedding automation into prototyping, test creation, and continuous integration practices. The role requires close collaboration across teams, particularly in system analysis efforts focused on testability, scalability, and delivering high‑quality software.
They lead the creation and enhancement of automation frameworks, ensuring they are robust, maintainable, and aligned with business and industry standards. The engineer evaluates how code changes affect both users and internal systems, maintains high levels of script reliability by reviewing work from junior team members, and supports overall quality engineering efforts. Working closely with DevOps and development teams, they integrate automated tests into CI/CD pipelines and help manage expectations around release readiness and test coverage.
The role includes defining automation standards, producing essential documentation, and staying informed about emerging QA technologies to recommend improvements. The engineer independently troubleshoots complex issues across environments or automation scripts and leads unit, integration, and end‑to‑end testing to ensure system security and stability. They also contribute strategically by participating in product architecture discussions, promoting test‑driven development, and ensuring long-term maintainability throughout each application’s lifecycle.
This position is a hybrid role requiring at least 2 days per week in the Allen, TX office location.
The target salary range for this position is $92,100 – $125,000, based on experience and location.
What you'll be responsible for:
Performs and may lead system analysis and programming activities which may require research and timely, effective, and quality delivery of software into production.

Adheres to documented departmental and corporate standards. Participates in the definition and documentation of standards.
May lead unit tests and integration tests to ensure the reliability, security, and performance of developed software.
Debugs and troubleshoots issues as they arise, providing timely resolutions.

Strong problem-solving skills.
Ability to travel up to 5% to attend Jack Henry meetings, trainings, and/or professional conferences.

description_text:
General information

Description & Requirements
Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
At Jack Henry, we’re more than a technology company, we’re a force for good in financial services. We’re redefining how community banks and credit unions connect with the people they serve. Our mission is rooted in people inspired innovation, empowering financial institutions to deliver seamless, secure, and human centered experiences. We deliver cutting-edge solutions that are paving the way for the next generation of digital banking and payments, but our true impact begins with our associates.  If you're ready to help transform an industry and grow with a company that values purpose, collaboration, and excellence then we’d love to meet you.
Jack Henry is currently seeking a Solution Specialist to join our team. The Solution Specialist is responsible for partnering with Sales Representatives to actively drive and engage in the sales process for our core banking software and services offerings. They must be able to articulate technology and product positioning to both business and technical users. They will work closely with the sales team, internal business development and operations teams and ensure complete customer satisfaction through all stages of the sales process. They are also responsible for guiding product strategy, identifying market trends and competitive analysis.
This is a remote position and candidates must live within approximately a 70-mile radius of our office locations in Springfield, MO; Monett, MO; Allen, TX; Lenexa, KS; Cedar Falls, IA; Birmingham, AL; Charlotte, NC; or Louisville, KY.
All positions, regardless of location, may require an onsite interview or in-person onboarding requirement to verify your identity.
What you’ll be responsible for:
Interacts with prospective and existing financial institution customers to determine their needs and strategic direction and advises on solutions to help them achieve their objectives.
Provides product expertise and resources to Sales. Participates in strategic sales engagements, product demonstrations and requests for proposals. Articulates product strategy and promotes the offering.
Researches and identifies customer needs and market trends, and articulates findings in the form of product enhancements and requirements.
Researches competitor products and maintains competitive comparisons and evaluations.  Plays proactive role in product planning and design to ensure the product is differentiated from competitors in the marketplace and incorporates latest technologies.
Collaborates with Marketing to establish, enhance or distinguish product placement within the competitive arena.  Develops product profiles, competitive analysis, presentations, demos, white papers, and product updates.
Develops business plans and product positioning in the marketplace.  Provides strategic guidance to address product weaknesses.
Advises on pricing strategies.
May perform other duties as assigned.
What you’ll need to have:
Minimum of 5 years of sales experience or with Jack Henry Banking software.
Experience with one of the following: Teller and Teller Capture suite, including 4|sight, OutLink item processing, Synapsys CRM, or jhCall Center.
Must be able to travel up to 40%.
What would be nice for you to have:
Bachelor’s degree.
Jack Henry Platform experience.
Proven success presenting technology as a business solution.
Proven success selling in complicated sales surroundings with both technical and business buyers.
Strong selling and sales aptitude.
Strong communication and customer interaction skills.
Effective verbal, written and presentation skills.
If you got this far, we hope you're feeling excited about this opportunity. Even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement on this posting, we still encourage you to apply. We’re looking for passionate, driven individuals who align with our mission and can bring unique perspectives to our team.
Why Jack Henry?
At Jack Henry, we live by the motto: “
Do the right thing, do whatever it takes, and have fun.”
It’s more than a tagline, it’s the foundation of our culture. We recognize that our associates are the key to our success, and we’re deeply committed to their wellbeing. That’s why we offer
comprehensive benefits
designed to support your physical, mental, and financial health so you can thrive both personally and professionally.
We’re also leading the way in technology modernization, helping financial institutions evolve with speed, security, and flexibility. Our strategy focuses on delivering secure data access, mitigating fraud, and enabling seamless integration.  Empowering our teams to build innovative solutions that meet the evolving needs of accountholders.
Culture of Commitment
Ask our associates why they love Jack Henry, and many will tell you it is because our culture is exceptional. We do great things together. Our culture empowers us to rise to challenges, seek new opportunities, and support one another through change. It’s this shared commitment that drives our success. We’re proud to foster an environment where inclusion, sustainability, and community impact are more than values, they’re how we operate.  Visit our
Corporate Sustainability
site to learn more about our culture and commitment to our people, customers, community, environment, and shareholders.
Equal Employment Opportunity
At Jack Henry, we know we are better together. We value, respect, and protect the uniqueness each of us brings. Innovation flourishes by including all voices and makes our business - and our society - stronger. Jack Henry is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to providing equal opportunity in all of our employment practices, including selection, hiring, performance management, promotion, transfer, compensation, benefits, education, training, social, and recreational activities to all persons regardless of race, religious creed, color, national origin, ancestry, physical disability, mental disability, genetic information, pregnancy, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, sexual orientation, and military and veteran status, or any other protected status protected by local, state or federal law.
No one will be subject to, and Jack Henry prohibits, any form of discipline, reprisal, intimidation, or retaliation for good faith reports or complaints of discrimination of any kind, pursuing any discrimination claim, or cooperating in related investigations.
Requests for full corporate job descriptions may be requested through the interview process at any time.

Press space or enter keys to toggle section visibility
At Jack Henry, we deliver technology solutions that are digitally transforming and empowering community banks and credit unions to provide enhanced and streamlined user experiences to their customers and members. Our best-in-class products are just the start as we lay the groundwork for the future of digital banking and payments. We hope you'll join us. We can't do it without you.
We are seeking a Sourcing Category Manager – Advisor with strong expertise in Professional Services and reseller procurement to help shape how Jack Henry partners with its most critical external providers. In this highly visible role, you will lead category strategy, negotiate complex service and reseller agreements, and establish best-in-class governance models that enable the business to move fast while managing cost and risk.
You will work closely with IT, Finance, Legal, and business leaders as a trusted advisor—helping teams select the right partners, structure engagements for success, and maximize the value delivered through consulting, systems integrators, managed services, and reseller relationships. This role is ideal for someone who enjoys influencing enterprise decisions, solving complex commercial challenges, and driving meaningful impact through strategic sourcing and supplier collaboration.
This position may be worked remotely within the United States, with the exception of California.
This position will have a salary range of $105,060 – 175,000 based on experience and location.
What you'll be responsible for:
Work with key business partners and senior leadership to gain a solid understanding of strategic direction and supply requirements, corporate business objectives and priorities to develop category specific supply strategies. Provide market and industry intelligence to help inform and shape strategy.
Analyze industry trends and evolving technology to proactively identify supply base opportunities to reduce cost, minimize risk, protect continuity of supply, and exploit industry developments that benefit JHA.
Manage contracts and suppliers within the targeted categories through supplier scorecards, periodic business reviews; active monitoring of supplier performance and risk, measuring contract compliance and other key metrics to ensure targets are being met and value is being delivered to the business under the supply agreements.
Lead sourcing engagements and cross-functional teams in opportunity identification and RFXs where appropriate.
Identify and pursue opportunities to leverage and consolidate the supply base using system level tools and techniques.
Negotiate and implement supplier agreements/contracts that meet the business needs of cross-functional stakeholders and achieve sustainable relationships with suppliers.
Evaluate supplier core competencies and competitive positioning using industry cost models.
Pro-actively enable and ensure transparency of spend and drive for an optimization of efficiency (procedures and cost) in collaboration with Finance function and related stakeholders
Lead supplier selection processes in alignment with business partners and negotiate contracts up to final authorization
Work with legal team to lead and oversee complex contract negotiations.
Assist the financial planning and budgeting process and monitor adherence to the budget.
Ensure internal customers adhere to the delegation of authority and procurement processes.
Performs additional tasks and special projects as determined by department management.
May assist less experienced peers.
May Perform other duties as assigned.
What you'll need to have:
Must have a minimum of 10 years of combination experience in any of the following: strategic sourcing, category management (software, reseller, referral agreements and professional services), vendor management, procurement in a service or fintech industry (indirect purchasing).
Must have advanced level of experience in red lining agreements.
Proficient level of experience in pricing negotiation with suppliers.
Must have the ability to handle multi million dollar deals with complex structures.
Timeline driven and self-prioritize and recognize when escalation is needed.
Must be able to travel up to 5% to attend Jack Henry meetings, trainings, and/or professional conferences.
Must be able to work extended hours during major negotiations or RFx cycles.
Must have strong business acumen skills.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Must have strong data analysis experience in presenting to leadership.
Must be process oriented.
What would be nice for you to have:
Bachelor’s degree in business, finance, engineering or supply chain.
Experience with digital sourcing platforms (e.g., Oracle Fusion, Coupa, Ariba, Jaggaer, GEP).
Experience utilizing contract lifecycle management (CLM) systems.
Managing e-sourcing tools.
Experience utilizing AI, automation, or predictive analytics in procurement.
Track record of driving supplier diversity and sustainability initiatives.
If you got this far, we hope you're feeling excited about this opportunity. Even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement on this positing, we still encourage you to apply. We're eager to meet motivated people who align with Jack Henry's mission and can contribute to our company in a variety of ways.
Why Jack Henry?
At Jack Henry, we pride ourselves through our motto of, "Do the right thing, do whatever it takes, and have fun." We recognize the value of our associates and believe much of our company's strength and success depends on their well-being.
We demonstrate our commitment by offering outstanding
benefit programs
to ensure the physical, mental & financial well-being of our people is always met.
Culture of Commitment
Ask our associates why they love Jack Henry, and many will tell you it is because our culture is exceptional. We do great things together. Rising to meet challenges and seeking opportunities is part of who we are as an organization. Our culture has helped us stay strong through challenging times and we credit our dedicated associates for our success. Visit our
Corporate Responsibility
site to learn more about our culture and commitment to our people, customers, community, environment, and shareholders.
Equal Employment Opportunity
At Jack Henry, we know we are better together. We value, respect, and protect the uniqueness each of us brings. Innovation flourishes by including all voices and makes our business - and our society - stronger. Jack Henry is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to providing equal opportunity in all of our employment practices, including selection, hiring, performance management, promotion, transfer, compensation, benefits, education, training, social, and recreational activities to all persons regardless of race, religious creed, color, national origin, ancestry, physical disability, mental disability, genetic information, pregnancy, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, sexual orientation, and military and veteran status, or any other protected status protected by local, state or federal law.

Under minimal supervision, work large complex tasks with occasional assistance from manager. Possesses communication skills required to complete tasks, leadership skills, and mastery of Analyst and Advanced Analyst skills.  The ideal candidate is knowledgeable about information systems and security with a hunger to learn the intricacies of audit and compliance.

Audit Facilitation:
Lead and manage compliance and audit activities, serving as the central point of contact (CPC) for internal and external audits, and directly coordinating with system owners across Complementary Solutions organization.
Manage multiple SOC 1 and SOC 2 audits simultaneously to ensure timely report delivery in a complex environment.
Conduct thorough reviews and validation of control implementations, ensuring that all supporting documentation is meticulously prepared and audit-ready at all times.
Compliance Oversight:
Evaluate changes to the Business Unit environment and Jack Henry policies to determine their effect on BU processes and controls.
Obtain and maintain in-depth knowledge of Complementary Solutions systems, processes, underlying technologies, and controls relevant to SOC 1 and SOC 2 reports.
Stay comprehensively up to date on evolving regulatory changes and provide proactive, expert guidance to department management and staff on external requirements, audit concerns, and internal control best practices.
Drive timely and complete responses to audit-related requests, actively coordinating with and assisting control owners in responding to audit evidence and follow-up requests.
Systematically follow up on internal and external findings from security-related reviews and other third-party assessments, ensuring accountability and resolution.
Remediation Support
Proactively monitor and track Complementary Solutions Threat & Vulnerability and Patch management dashboards.  Ensure that BUs remediation plans are clearly noted, actively followed, progress is effectively communicated, and resolved in a timely manner.
Standardization of Procedures
Consolidate and standardize business unit procedures into a consistent, division-wide document that is also aligned with Jack Henry policies.
Enterprise Initiatives
Participate in governance, risk, compliance, and security initiatives for Jack Henry as assigned.

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Technology, or Information Security.
Minimum of 6 years experience in Information Security.
Experience coordinating IT compliance and audit activities and supporting compliance requirements for SOC audits.
Familiarity with security and controls standards, frameworks, and best practices (e.g., SOC, NIST, COBIT, COSO, ISO 27001).
Organizational and communication skills.
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Strong attention to detail.
What would be nice for you to have:
Has a wide range of experience and able to resolve complex issues.  Works on complex and diverse projects.  Analysis requires an in-depth evaluation of variable factors.  Exercises good judgment in selecting methods, techniques and evaluation criteria for obtaining solutions.
Experience with cloud platforms.
Project management skills.
Able to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions.
Able to meet aggressive deadlines.
Certification such as Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA), Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP), Certified Information Security Manager (CISM), GIAC or equivalent IT audit and controls related certification.

description_text:

Description & Requirements

At Jack Henry, we’re more than a technology company, we’re a force for good in financial services. We’re redefining how community banks and credit unions connect with the people they serve. Our mission is rooted in people inspired innovation, empowering financial institutions to deliver seamless, secure, and human centered experiences. We deliver cutting-edge solutions that are paving the way for the next generation of digital banking and payments, but our true impact begins with our associates. If you're ready to help transform an industry and grow with a company that values purpose, collaboration, and excellence then we’d love to meet you
At Jack Henry, we're seeking a Senior Network Support Engineer to become a vital part of our Enterprise Network team. In this role, you'll oversee and enhance our sophisticated network infrastructure, which spans from datacenters to millions of end-users across financial institutions. Our technology environment combines cutting-edge wired and wireless solutions, offering you a chance to innovate and excel.
As a Senior Network Support Engineer, you'll manage network moves, upgrades, and incident resolution. You'll troubleshoot complex wired and wireless connectivity issues, implement network optimizations, and ensure robust, high-performing connectivity across our organization. This is an ideal opportunity for professionals eager to leverage their expertise in enterprise-scale environments and grow within a fast-paced, technology-driven organization.
This position may be worked remotely within the United States, with the exception of California.
All positions, regardless of location, may require an onsite interview or in-person onboarding requirement to verify your identity.
Must be able to travel up to 20% to attend onsite meetings or trainings.
What you’ll be responsible for:
Assist in maintaining and deploying multi-vendor high-availability network solutions to support enterprise and data centers environments, ensuring compliance with financial industry regulations and security standards.
Configure and maintain network devices such as routers, switches, Wireless Controllers (eg Cisco, Arista).
Support the implementation of dynamic routing and transport protocols such BGP, EIGRP, OSPF, MPLS.
Maintain and leverage network automation scripts using Python, Ansible to safely execute changes to production network devices.
Provide hardware and software support for the Wireless Environment across all Jack Henry locations.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Security, Systems, and Operations, to deliver reliable and secure network services.
Utilize existing SOPs to execute disaster recovery and business continuity exercises.
Participate in capacity planning and network expansion projects, ensuring scalability and future proofing of the infrastructure to meet the growing needs of banks and credit unions.
Create and maintain detailed network documentation, including diagrams, configurations, and operational procedures.
Regularly troubleshoot, resolve network issues
Participate in on-call rotation with other members of the team
Providing guidance to junior engineers and support staff.
Stay current with emerging networking technologies and recommend improvements to enhance performance and reduce operational risk.
May perform other duties as assigned.
What you’ll need to have:
At least 6 years of experience in network engineering within a large enterprise environment.
Expertise in Layer 2 and Layer 3 networking protocols, including VLANs, STP, BGP, OSPF, MPLS, and Wi-Fi technologies.
Hands-on experience with network automation and scripting (eg Ansible/Python).
Familiarity with SD-WAN and cloud networking solutions (eg AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and documentation skills.
What would be nice for you to have:
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology.
Cisco CCIE or CCNP.
Arista ACS.
Working Knowledge of Cisco ACI and Arista Fabric networking solutions.
Datacenter or service provider routing and switching experience.
Experience deploying MOPs.
Experience in the Fintech or Financial Services Sector.
If you got this far, we hope you're feeling excited about this opportunity. Even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement on this posting, we still encourage you to apply. We’re looking for passionate, driven individuals who align with our mission and can bring unique perspectives to our team.
Why Jack Henry?
At Jack Henry, we live by the motto: “Do the right thing, do whatever it takes, and have fun.” It’s more than a tagline, it’s the foundation of our culture. We recognize
that our associates are the key to our success, and we’re deeply committed to their wellbeing. That’s why we offer comprehensive benefits designed to support your physical, mental, and financial health so you can thrive both personally and professionally.
We’re also leading the way in technology modernization, helping financial institutions evolve with speed, security, and flexibility. Our strategy focuses on delivering secure data access, mitigating fraud, and enabling seamless integration. Empowering our teams to build innovative solutions that meet the evolving needs of accountholders.
Culture of Commitment
Ask our associates why they love Jack Henry, and many will tell you it is because our culture is exceptional. We do great things together. Our culture empowers us to rise to challenges, seek new opportunities, and support one another through change. It’s this shared commitment that drives our success. We’re proud to foster an environment where inclusion, sustainability, and community impact are more than values, they’re how we operate. Visit our Corporate Sustainability site to learn more about our culture and commitment to our people, customers, community, environment, and shareholders.

description_text:

At Jack Henry, we’re more than a technology company, we’re a force for good in financial services. We’re redefining how community banks and credit unions connect with the people they serve. Our mission is rooted in people inspired innovation, empowering financial institutions to deliver seamless, secure, and human centered experiences. We deliver cutting-edge solutions that are paving the way for the next generation of digital banking and payments, but our true impact begins with our associates.  If you're ready to help transform an industry and grow with a company that values purpose, collaboration, and excellence then we’d love to meet you.
About the Team
Our team plays a critical role in empowering all product teams across the organization by providing comprehensive and scalable Observability solutions. We are responsible for designing, building, and maintaining robust telemetry pipelines that leverage a strategic blend of open-source tools (e.g., OpenTelemetry, Prometheus) and leading commercial platforms (e.g., Datadog, Honeycomb). This enables us to offer centralized logging, metrics monitoring, and distributed tracing capabilities, ensuring that engineering teams have the insights they need to build, deploy, and operate reliable, high-performing services.
We want our organization to be one that supports, challenges, and motivates you to build strong, dynamic connections with your coworkers. We promote a hardworking, highly communicative, flexible, and transparent culture. How well work integrates with your life is an important quality of a healthy individual and organization. In the world of remote work that is always on and always connected we pay attention to providing margin and space for the things you hold dear.
This position may be worked remotely within the United States, with the exceptions of California.
This position is not eligible for immigration sponsorship and support. Please do not apply if at any time you will need immigration support now or in the future (i.e., H-1B, STEM OPT Training Plans, etc.).
All positions, regardless of location, may require an onsite interview or in-person onboarding requirement to verify your identity.
What you’ll be responsible for:
Plan, design and build the observability blueprints used by Jack Henry's development and engineering teams. Craft the overarching strategy and create detailed designs for how observability will be implemented for various products & services across the organization. This includes defining data flows & telemetry pipelines into the appropriate platform (like Datadog, Honeycomb, Prometheus, etc.) and establishing best practices for instrumentation.
Resolve critical observability incidents that impact the ability to monitor and understand system behavior. This engineer will lead the effort to pinpoint the root cause, implement solutions, and prevent recurrence. This requires deep expertise in observability tools and techniques.
Design and implement automated pipelines for deploying, configuring, and managing observability tools and instrumentation. This includes automating tasks such as agent installation, configuration updates, and alert provisioning, leveraging IaC principles and tools.
Responsible for ensuring the observability systems themselves are healthy, reliable, and providing accurate data. Also champion the use of observability to improve the overall health and resilience of production systems, enabling faster detection and mitigation of potential problems.
Actively engage with product teams to understand their upcoming projects, technology choices, and observability needs. Ensure that observability is embedded early in the development lifecycle and provide the insights necessary to optimize application performance and reliability.
May perform other job duties as assigned.
What you’ll need to have:
Minimum of 10 years of experience in Software Development, Observability Engineering, or Site Reliability Engineering.
Minimum of 5 years of in-depth experience with Observability platforms like Datadog, Dynatrace, Honeycomb, New Relic, Splunk, or Prometheus.
Minimum of 4 years of cloud experience with Azure, AWS, or GCP.
Minimum 4 years of experience building and managing telemetry pipelines, including at least 1 year of hands-on experience with OpenTelemetry
Minimum of 4 years of experience with Kubernetes environments
Understanding and experience with declarative infrastructure using Terraform.
Must be able to work an on-call rotation that may include weekends as the business need dictates.
What would be nice for you to have:
Proven ability to collect logs, metrics & traces and implement Observability solutions for applications and infrastructure.
Solid understanding of distributed tracing and experience instrumenting applications to analyze performance bottlenecks.
Hands-on experience configuring and deploying OTEL collectors for telemetry data collection, processing and export.
Strong understanding of Kubernetes architecture and experience managing observability within K8s environments.
Proficiency in using Kustomize for Kubernetes configurations and Terraform for infrastructure provisioning.
Experience integrating observability practices and tools into CI/CD pipelines for automated deployments.
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills to diagnose and resolve complex issues within observability systems, including data pipeline failures, instrumentation errors, and performance bottlenecks.
Ability to demonstrate a strong Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) mindset with a focus on automation, proactive monitoring, and continuous improvement to ensure system reliability and availability.
Experience defining and implementing Service Level Objectives (SLOs) and Service Level Indicators (SLIs) to measure system performance and drive data-driven decisions.
If you got this far, we hope you're feeling excited about this opportunity. Even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement on this posting, we still encourage you to apply. We’re looking for passionate, driven individuals who align with our mission and can bring unique perspectives to our team.
Why Jack Henry?
At Jack Henry, we live by the motto: “
Do the right thing, do whatever it takes, and have fun.”

comprehensive benefits

We’re also leading the way in technology modernization, helping financial institutions evolve with speed, security, and flexibility. Our strategy focuses on delivering secure data access, mitigating fraud, and enabling seamless integration.  Empowering our teams to build innovative solutions that meet the evolving needs of accountholders.
Culture of Commitment
Ask our associates why they love Jack Henry, and many will tell you it is because our culture is exceptional. We do great things together. Our culture empowers us to rise to challenges, seek new opportunities, and support one another through change. It’s this shared commitment that drives our success. We’re proud to foster an environment where inclusion, sustainability, and community impact are more than values, they’re how we operate.   Visit our

site to learn more about our culture and commitment to our people, customers, community, environment, and shareholders.

You’ll utilize cutting‑edge tools and technologies to analyze and resolve complex server, network, and customer issues in a fast‑paced environment. Ability to quickly adapt to and learn new technologies.
Proficient in practical, WAN/LAN communication troubleshooting.
Infrastructure equipment installation and configuration experience.
PC/desktop/peripheral support experience.
Strong experience with server implementation and troubleshooting.
UNIX/Linux command-line administration experience (AIX preferred).
Basic knowledge of Windows servers administration.
Basic concept of virtualization
Microsoft SQL server administration experience is a plus.
Microsoft Active Directory administration experience is a plus.
Credit Union or Banking Industry experience is a plus.
Bachelor's degree with an MIS emphasis or equivalent experience.
Network+ or A+ certification or equivalent network/infrastructure support experience.

Are you passionate about technology and skilled at making complex subjects accessible to everyone? Our organization is investing heavily in critical technical skills—from AI literacy to advanced cloud specialists— and we need an innovator to design and deliver high-impact learning experiences that drive skill transformation across the organization.
As a core member of the Tech Skills Team, you will specialize in using AI and automation to enhance the design and delivery of our technical curriculum. If you have a background in or strong affinity for tech and are excited by the challenge of leveraging cutting-edge tools to drive skill development at scale, this is your chance to contribute directly to our organizational transformation.
This is a remote position, and candidates must live within approximately a 70-mile radius of our office locations in Allen, TX; Springfield, MO; or Monett, MO.
All positions, regardless of location, may require an onsite interview or in-person onboarding requirement to verify your identity.
What you’ll be responsible for:
You will be a key contributor in the design, delivery, and management of technical learning experiences, ensuring our associates have the skills needed for the future.
Design Technical Learning Journeys: Apply instructional design principles (with guidance) to create engaging, high-impact learning paths focused on critical technical skills (e.g., specific cloud platforms, advanced programming languages, etc.).
AI/Automation in Learning: Assist in designing and developing learning experiences that are delivered or enhanced using AI tools and automation—think personalized coaching prompts or automated content curation.
Prototype New Tools: Contribute to prototyping and implementing new EdTech, focusing on tools that can specifically accelerate technical skill acquisition.
Research Emerging Tech: Help research and evaluate emerging technologies in the learning and development space, specifically those relevant to technical training and skill validation.
Tech Learning Library Management: Support the management and optimization of our extensive library of tech learning licenses and platforms (LinkedIn Learning, Pluralsight, Google Skills).
Engagement Reporting: Collect, organize, and analyze learning engagement data (completions, usage rates, skill lift) to report on the effectiveness and ROI of our technical learning investments.
Collaborate closely with subject matter experts, L&D Specialists, and other stakeholders to share findings and support the adoption of new learning solutions.
Perform other duties as assigned to support team initiatives and Talent Development events and enhance learning experiences across Jack Henry.
What you'll need to have:
Minimum of 18 months experience in learning experience technical design, technology implementation, AI/tool management, workflow automation, or content development in a technical or learning environment.
AI/Productivity Tool Experience: Direct experience applying AI tools (e.g., generative AI, LLMs) to enhance productivity or used for content creation in a technical or learning context.
Technical Aptitude: A strong interest in or foundational knowledge of critical technical domains (e.g., software development lifecycle, cloud technologies, data analytics).
Skills: Demonstrated ability to work under moderate supervision, contribute to project initiatives, and assist with data collection and analysis.
What would be nice for you to have:
Education: Bachelor’s degree.
Data Analysis Skills: Ability to collect, interpret, and present learning data from various sources to drive improvements in learning design and delivery (experience with Tableau, Power BI, or standards such as xAPI is a plus).
Advanced AI Integration: Practical knowledge of how to integrate AI agents or automation into learning workflows for personalized or scaled delivery.
Portfolio: A portfolio showing examples of instructional design for technical or complex subject matter.

We deliver cutting-edge solutions that are paving the way for the next generation of digital banking and payments, but our true impact begins with our associates.  If you're ready to help transform an industry and grow with a company that values purpose, collaboration, and excellence then we’d love to meet you.
Our Lending Technical Support team is seeking a Technical Support Engineer to join the team.  We are growing this group as we approach a large initiative in Jack Henry that will shift many hosted, Microsoft VM workloads into the cloud.  In this role, you will provide technical support through a variety of activities including (but not limited to) the creation of virtual environments consisting of virtual Microsoft Servers (Windows, IIS, SQL), security, networking, high availability, observability and performance monitoring within the Google Cloud Platform (GCP).  Additional responsibilities will include new customer product installations, existing customer support case troubleshooting, working with third party vendors and other Jack Henry integration and Technical partners.
This position is a remote position, and candidates must live within approximately a 70-mile radius of our office locations in Allen, TX; Lenexa, KS; Louisville, KY: Cedar falls, IA; Birmingham, AL; Charlotte, NC; Springfield, MO; or Monett, MO.
All positions, regardless of location, may require an onsite interview or in-person onboarding requirement to verify your identity.
What you’ll be responsible for:
Google Cloud Platform (GCP) multi-regional project buildouts of highly available virtual environments including security (Cloud Armor and Active Directory), networking (DNS maintenance, load balancers, ingress/egress dataflows), virtual Microsoft servers (Windows, IIS, SQL), observability and performance monitoring using DataDog.
GCP Cloud Armor maintenance, Global Load balancers, secret vault maintenance and Cloud Storage bucket maintenance.
Interacts with product support personnel, and potentially the customer, when the customer’s problem cannot be resolved directly by first-level resources.
Provides technical assistance to customers. Provides support to customers/users if product issues are encountered. Analyzes the problem as described by the customer and determines the best course of action.
Accurately report any design, reliability and maintenance problems or bugs to software engineering.
Prepares test environment when necessary to simulate, document or recreate errors or problems reported by customer to determine appropriate action. May prepare test environment and test new enhancements or other internal quality testing.
Maintains familiarity with company products by attending training classes, observing experienced support personnel, reading software documentation, and participating in on-line training programs.
May be involved in customer installations, upgrades, and training.
Scheduled “after-hours” support as needed.
May perform other job duties as assigned.
What you’ll need to have:
Minimum of 4 years of experience in technical support role installing and maintaining Microsoft Windows Server, Internet Information Services (IIS), SQL Server, Web Application and pooling within the Google Cloud Platform (GCP) providing regional high availability.
Minimum of 2 years of experience using Terraform in Cloud Infrastructure, Networking Infrastructure, Domain Name System (DNS) design and troubleshooting in Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
Minimum of 2 years of experience working with Octopus, Ansible and PowerShell using parameters to create custom cmdlets and deployment scripts in the Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
Minimum of 1 year of experience working with Datadog, GitHub and GitHub Actions.

Bachelor’s Degree with focus on Banking, Accounting, Finance, or Business.
